EmailTemplate.name: RE: FW: David Fincher - SOW - 2013-05-20 (1368457445.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: FW: David Fincher - SOW - 2013-05-20 (1368457445.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Dave, I am so sorry you have had to go through all of this trouble. We have a list of notary’s that we know will work with us, you can find that list here. <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.mbopartners.com/notaries?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb0Fculd67u%2FIAqHiizjBc5TmuLNwY52MuKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> I do want to clarify what MBO is asking the notary to do. Section 2 of the I-9 form is for the employer or "authorized representative" of the employer to sign in the case of a remote hire (such as yours.) Because you are a remote hire, we are asking a notary to act as the authorized representative for MBO because we deem them as a "person of trust" it is completely up to them whether they choose to act in this capacity for us. When they sign and date the document they can sign as a “authorized representative” (if they prefer) for their title and there is no need for any kind of notary stamp. They are not witnessing the documents, only the signature. We are not asking them to notarize the form. Understandably (and unfortunately) a lot of confusion occurs when we ask a notary to sign and date a form as an authorized representative because they have the “position of trust” that a notary carries but not to notarize the document or act in an official notary capacity on the document. It’s like asking an office notary to sign for a package (because you trust them) but not to notarize the document stating they received the package. Chris – is there a notary in your office that could sign the I-9 form for Dave? Dave – I will give you a call shortly. Thanks,Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Dave Fincher [mailto:dfincher7@gmail.com] Sent: Saturday, May 11, 2013 8:36 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: FW: David Fincher - SOW - 2013-05-20 Sara and Chris, I spent most of Saturday morning trying to find a Notary who would sign the I-9 form. The excuses I was given in every case was that they either did not do I-9's or they did not verify ID's, they only verified signatures. Chris, Is it possible to have someone in your office take care of this? Sara, When you have time on Monday please give me a call at 303-483-1277. I have some questions about setting up payroll, and how soon funds will be available after being deposited. Thank you,Dave Fincher On Fri, May 10, 2013 at 10:32 AM, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>> wrote:Hi Dave,
I wish I could sign off on them but unfortunately E-Verify stipulates that they have to be done in person. Since you are in CO and I am in VA we ask that notary act as the authorized representative listed in section 2 of the form.
You can find the I-9 form in your enrollment documents; you will sign/date section 1 and a local notary will sign/date section 2 ( there will be instructions on how to complete this form in your enrollment documents as well.) You can send this back to me via email (I don't need a hard copy.) I will also need you to send me a copy of your US passport (you can just take a picture with your phone and email that to me.)
Please feel free to reach out to me with any questions.
Thanks!Sara
___________________________________ SARA CONDE Consultant Services Advisor MBO Partners
t: 703.793.6028 <tel:703.793.6028> f: 703.793.6068 <tel:703.793.6068> e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com>
Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files.
-----Original Message----- From: Dave Fincher [mailto:dfincher7@gmail.com <mailto:dfincher7@gmail.com>]Sent: Friday, May 10, 2013 12:26 PM To: Sara Conde Cc: Christopher Lee (clee@fahrenheitit.com <mailto:clee@fahrenheitit.com>) Subject: Re: FW: David Fincher - SOW - 2013-05-20
Sara,I have the I-9 and will send it as soon as I can. Question on the verification documents. Who should sign off on the verification of documents. I can fill out the information, should I send scanned copies to you for the verification or will I need to find someone locally that can do that for me.
Thanks, Dave Fincher
